main.name: Ashwin Ramakrishnan
main.description: Mobile development engineer who works with Flutter and native Android
main.bio: Google Summer of Code'20 intern at The Mifos Initiative. Student mentor at amFOSS - India's leading open-source enthusiasts' club. Cross-platform developer with Flutter/KMM and native android developer with Java/Kotlin.

education.degree: B. Tech in Computer Science and Engineering

work.title: Student Mentor
work.description: Was a part of my college's student-run OSS club, where I dedicated my time into contributing to open source software, learning along with others, mentoring juniors, working on personality development, and much more.

work.title: Flutter and MEAN developer
work.description: Worked extensively on a trivia mobile app built using Flutter backed by MEAN stack with Firebase. Introduced several features, bug fixes and helped the app go live.

work.title: Associate Tech Engineer
work.description: Worked on the Spoon first mobile app build on Flutter. Co-ordinated with companies such as setu.co and theflyy.com to integrate their solutions into the Spoon first app.

work.title: Intern
work.description: Worked on converting Mifos Mobile, a client-facing android app written in Java to work fully on Kotlin and adapt its best practices. Integrated Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile (KMM) to help enable the app to work on both iOS and Android with the business login commonly written in Kotlin
